sentence.idiomatic: Just pull to the side and stop.
That boy on the left--stand more toward the center.
Are there any seats by the window?
I definitely will never believe you again.
You absolutely cannot tell other people.
I guarantee that he will definitely come tomorrow.
I heard that he lost a lot of money in business last year.
If he was losing money, he definitely wouldn't sell it to you.
Now with gas prices so high, if you're not losing money it's pretty good.
If you continue on being lax in your studies, we'll make you be a cattle herder.
If you don't get up you're going to be late.
If you continue doing wrong, I won't be able to help you either.
This is a fake. You were conned by the seller.
I was cheated out of 500 RMB by someone on the street. What terrible luck.
I believe in you so much, don't deceive me.
Hey! Sir, ma'am... do you need tickets? These are the last two.
Let me take a look. Wow, the seats are quite close to the front. How much are they a piece?
800. Relax, these are definitely real tickets.
1,000 for the two of them.
No way, no way. I'll lose money.
It started ten minutes ago, if you don't sell them you will lose even more money.
Forget it, I'll give them to you!
First let my girlfriend take a ticket. If she can get in with it, I'll pay you your money.
Uh... all right. Take this ticket. Look, she got in.
OK, here is your money.
Hey, hey, hey! This is a fake ticket. You can't go in!
Huh? The scalpers swindled me again.
